The only fixed point of the rabbit-fox system is
$\left(r^\star, f^\star\right) = \left(\frac{\alpha}{\beta}, -\frac{\delta}{\gamma}\right)$ 


The linearized dynamics around this fixed point are:
$$\partial_t r = 
\left(\alpha + \frac{\beta\gamma}{\delta}\right) [r - r^\star] + 
\alpha [f - f^\star]\\
\partial_t f = 
- \delta [r - r^\star] + 
\left(\delta + \frac{\alpha\beta}{\delta}\right) [f - f^\star]$$


Using the formula for eigenvalues, calculate the eigenvalues symbolically and report on the stability of the fixed point.
